trans-unit.source: Provides a base implementation for a ComponentEditorPage.
The ComponentEditorPage class is a complete implementation for a component editor page that consists of an empty window.
You can extend this page to add your own controls.
ComponentEditorPage is used by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage"></xref> class.
Activates and displays the page.
Applies changes to all the components being edited.
This property is not relevant for this class.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if enabled; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
This event is not relevant for this class.
To be added.
Specifies whether the editor should apply its changes before it is deactivated.
The standard implementation returns `false`.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the editor should apply its changes; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the component to edit.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> this page allows you to edit.
Gets the creation parameters for the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CreateParams"></xref> that indicates the creation parameters for the control.
Deactivates and hides the page.
Increments the loading counter.
Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the EnterLoadingMode method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page.

When a loading procedure that called EnterLoadingMode completes, it should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ExitLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete.
A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.
Decrements the loading counter.

Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page.

When a loading procedure that called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> completes, it should call the ExitLoadingMode method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete.
A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the page is being activated for the first time.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the page has not previously been activated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the control that represents the window for this page.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that represents the window for this page.
Gets the component that is to be edited.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> that is to be edited.
Gets or sets the icon for the page.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Icon"></xref> used to represent the page.
Gets a value indicating whether the page is being activated for the first time.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if this is the first time the page is being activated; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the page is being loaded.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the page is being loaded; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Processes messages that could be handled by the page.
This method gives the page a chance to process messages before the caller uses them.
If this returns `true`, the message will be consumed; otherwise, the caller will continue to process the message.
The message to process.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the page processed the message; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Loads the component into the page user interface (UI).
Indicates how many load dependencies remain until loading has been completed.
This property is used to track the number of loading stages remaining.
For each process needed to completely load the document, this counter is incremented before loading begins, and decremented when each loading process completes.
The number of remaining load dependencies.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a component must be loaded before editing can occur.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if a component must be loaded before editing can occur; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Called when the page and any sibling pages have applied their changes.
Gets or sets the page site.
The site for this component editor page.
The page site.
Reloads the component for the page.
This method is called when the current component may have changed elsewhere and needs to be reloaded into the user interface (UI).
Saves the component from the page user interface (UI).
Sets the component to be edited.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref> to be edited.
Sets the page as changed since the last load or save.
Sets the site for this page.
The site for this page.
Shows Help information if the page supports Help information.
This is only called if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.SupportsHelp%2A> returns `true`.
The Help system calls the ShowHelp method to provide Help for the page.
ShowHelp is usually called in response to F1 or when the Help button is clicked to allow the page to bring up its associated Help topic.
Gets a value indicating whether the editor supports Help.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the editor supports Help; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default implementation returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the title of the page.
The caller may use this to show the name of this editor before it's actually activated.
The title of the page.
